channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: 2026-27 Learning Assistant Applications Open!
item.description: Apply today to become a Learning Assistant for the 2026-27 Academic Year! Our Learning Assistants (LAs) support RPI’s orientation experiences and host interactive first-year and sophomore workshops and programs throughout the year to help students thrive academically, socially, and personally. Applications are due on February 26th!
item.author: Students

item.title: President’s Day Weekend Hours for Dining Halls and Retail
item.description: Dining and Retail locations will operate on adjusted hours from Saturday, February 14th through Monday, February 16th. Click the link above for hours of operations. Thank you and enjoy your President’s Day Weekend!
item.author: Students

item.title: ASCE Student Chapter Meeting with SASE
item.description: Date: Thursday, February 12, 2026 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Join members of ASCE and SASE for a presentation by CDM Smith. Learn about their projects and geotechnical engineering sector. This is great way to catch up with fellow students and network with professionals. Pizza will be provided by CDM Smith.
item.author: Students

item.title: RenXchange is Hiring!
item.description: Do you want to make a difference for RPI? Do you want to gain skills in fundraising, communication, and customer service? You’re in luck! RenXchange is hiring! Benefits include: convenient location at the DCC, competitive pay, a fun environment with other students, and flex scheduling. Spaces are limited – apply at https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/5620f155c9d94a76977dc3806bb3584c. For more information contact Uzi…
item.author: Students

item.title: First Year Experience Hosts with LA’s | Get Your Tuition’s Worth
item.description: Date: Sunday, February 15, 2026 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Make the most of your RPI experience! Learn how to fully leverage campus resources, academic opportunities, and support services to maximize your investment and set yourself up for long-term success.
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer Dining – February Upcoming Events
item.description: Rensselaer Dining has a variety of events planned throughout February. Join us and take part in food-focused activities, programs, and opportunities to share your feedback. Click the link above to find out more about our events.
item.author: Students

item.title: Apartment Search 101 Workshops
item.description: The Off-Campus Services Office will be holding workshops to learn about the process, resources available, and important considerations in selecting your housing. 2/19 2:30-4:30 p.m. RU3602 2/20 2:30-3:30 p.m. RU3202 2/25 2:30-4:30 p.m. 1525 15th St Questions, please email offcampus@rpi.edu
item.author: Students

item.title: Campus Card Office Closure – Presidents Day
item.description: Please note that the Campus Card Office will be closed in observance of Presidents Day on Monday, February 16, 2026. The office will resume normal business hours on Tuesday, February 17, 2026.
item.author: Community

item.title: MANE Graduate Programs Information Sessions
item.description: Date: Thursday, February 12, 2026 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM - Learn about the exciting research opportunities, program requirements, NEW funding options and application processes to MANE’s Accelerated Master’s (formally Co-term), BS-PhD, and traditional Masters and PhD programs.
item.author: Community

item.title: Information Security - Help us name our new AI Phishing Coach!
item.description: Our Information Security team is excited to announce that we will be deploying our new AI Phishing Coach, and are asking for our RPI Community’s assistance with sending us creative and fun names through our naming contest. Click above link to submit proposed names. Best name submission will win RPI merchandise! Submissions will close February 23rd.
item.author: Community

item.title: Experience Jewyo Rhii’s WING THEATER at EMPAC’s staging grounds festival
item.description: February 20-28, 2026 Jewyo Rhii’s WING THEATER, commissioned by EMPAC, oscillates between installation and activated performance space, with Rhii offering two live activations daily throughout the festival. At once a self-contained theater, a sculptural archive, and a staging ground for storytelling, the piece blurs the boundary between private process and collective encounter. Performance Jewyo Rhii
item.author: Community

item.title: Webinar Friday February 13: Webex Event Training
item.description: Hosting a campus event or supporting a student webinar? Join a hands-on Webex Event Training Webinar, part of the MMS Collaboration Software Training series. Register now for this webinar presented via Webex on Friday February 13 from 11am-12pm: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700 Learn the basics of Webex Event hosting, with demonstration and Q&A, along with new features recently added to the hosting platform.
item.author: Community

item.title: The Future of Computing Research Collaboration (FCRC) 2026 Annual Workshop
item.description:
This full-day workshop brings together RPI and IBM leadership, faculty, researchers, and students to highlight strategic priorities, research progress across the four FCRC tracks (AI Algorithms, AI HW/SW Codesign, Semiconductor Technology, and Quantum Computing), and future collaboration opportunities. Visit https://fcrc.rpi.edu/news for the agenda and registration link.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Community
